metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0217 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4 release 2.4.38 and prior, a race condition in mod_auth_digest when running in a threaded server could allow a user with valid credentials to authenticate using another username, bypassing configured access control restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-macro - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
No subscription required

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22').
apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22').
